doc.after: In January 2008, Boeing proposed the P-8I, a customized export variant of the P-8A, for the Indian Navy.[70] It features two major components not fitted on the P-8A, a Telephonics APS-143 OceanEye aft radar and a magnetic anomaly detector (MAD).[71] On 4 January 2009, India's Ministry of Defence signed a US$2.1Â billion agreement with Boeing for the supply of eight P-8Is to replace the Indian Navy's aging Tupolev Tu-142M maritime surveillance turboprops.[72][73] Each aircraft has an average cost of about US$220Â million.[74] India was the P-8's first international customer, and was also Boeing's first military sale to India.[75] In October 2010, India's Defence Acquisition Council approved the purchase of four additional P-8Is;[76][77] this purchase is reportedly under consideration as of 2014.[78] In 2011, India planned to order 12 more P-8Is at a later date.[79][80]
